Description: Fragmentary corner of a large warp-faced plain weave, linen cloth, possibly part of a bed-cover or mantle; mainly undyed linen but covered with loops either of undyed linen or purple-coloured wool; loops form a design of part of a large right-angled gamma motif enclosing a roundel; border design across the end of the cloth; beyond the loops are eight pairs of self-bands and a warp fringe; warp-undyed linen (S/c.18), weft-undyed linen (S/c.11); pile weft-undyed linen (S spun Z ply/triple); pile weft-purple wool (grouped threads) every 4th shed of main weft; 3 lengths of loops c.0.5cm, 1cm and 1.5cm; two simple selvedge, plain warp fringe 2cm long
Curator's comments: Unreg. 111; found in old cardboard box in M7
